page.title: 01TARBERT GAZETTEER
page.content: The School was allocated 4 D Blocks. Because of the scattered nature of the community,and to meet our own investigative needs,the twenty pages of text refer to all four blocks.Land cover and amenity statistics are entered on separate disks,but the text has been copied on to each disk. Tarbert is the central village in Harris,with a population of about 500. It is situated on the narrow isthmus between East and West Loch Tarbert.In Gaelic,"Tairbeart",means "Place over which a boat can be drawn".A car ferry provides direct contact with the Scottish mainland,via Skye.There is also a daily bus service to Stornoway the nearest airport.The township, linear in pattern, east to west, includes sixteen shops.It also has a post office,bank,two licenced hotels, community centre for social functions
